questions.text: A dependent source in a circuit is one whose value depends on:

choices.text: A voltage or current elsewhere in the circuit

questions.text: Resonance in a series RLC circuit is the condition where:

choices.text: The inductive reactance equals the capacitive reactance ($X_L = X_C$).

questions.text: The working principle of a transformer is based on:
A photodiode is a semiconductor device that converts:
The common-mode rejection ratio (CMRR) of an op-amp is a measure of its ability to:

choices.text: Amplify the difference between two input signals.
Reject signals that are common to both inputs.
Amplify a wide range of frequencies.

questions.text: The main purpose of a coupling capacitor in a multi-stage amplifier is to:

choices.text: Block the DC component from passing to the next stage while allowing the AC signal to pass.
Provide a path for DC current.

questions.text: Subtracting a binary number from another can be achieved by:

choices.text: Adding the 2's complement of the subtrahend.
Inverting all the bits of the subtrahend.

questions.text: A 'parity bit' is an extra bit added to a binary code to:
A 'ring counter' is a type of shift register where:

choices.text: The output of the first flip-flop is connected to the input of the last flip-flop.
The inverted output of the last flip-flop is connected to the input of the first flip-flop.
The output of the last flip-flop is connected to the input of the first flip-flop.
The counter counts in a random sequence.

questions.text: A 'machine cycle' in a CPU consists of the steps taken to:

choices.text: Execute a single high-level language statement.
Fetch, decode, and execute one machine-level instruction.

questions.text: In the context of microprocessors, what is an 'assembler'?

choices.text: A hardware component that assembles the CPU.
A software program that translates assembly language into machine code.
A program that interprets high-level code.

questions.text: In C, the -> operator is used to:

choices.text: Access a member of a structure or union using a variable of its type.
Access a member of a structure or union using a pointer to it.

questions.text: In C++, what is a 'copy constructor'?

choices.text: A constructor that takes no arguments.
A constructor that is used to create a new object as a copy of an existing object.
A constructor that cannot be called.
A constructor defined in a derived class.

questions.text: What is the function of the throw keyword in C++ exception handling?

choices.text: To specify a block of code to be tested for errors.
To define a block of code to be executed if an error occurs.
To signal that an exceptional condition has occurred.
To handle all types of exceptions.

questions.text: 'Out-of-order execution' is a technique used in high-performance CPUs to:

choices.text: Execute instructions in the order they appear in the program.
Improve performance by executing instructions as soon as their operands are ready, regardless of the original program order.
Reduce the power consumption of the CPU.
Simplify the design of the control unit.

questions.text: The 'address bus' of a computer system is used to:

choices.text: Transfer data between the CPU and memory.
Specify the memory location that the CPU wants to access.

questions.text: Task 'synchronization' in a multitasking system refers to:

choices.text: The coordination of the execution of multiple tasks.
The process of starting multiple tasks at the same time.
The scheduling of tasks based on their priority.

questions.text: The IEEE 802.11 standard is for:

choices.text: Wireless Local Area Networks (WLAN or Wi-Fi)

questions.text: A 'proxy server' is a server that acts as an intermediary for requests from clients seeking resources from other servers. One of its primary uses is:

choices.text: To provide content filtering, caching, and anonymity.

questions.text: 'Cryptography' is the practice and study of techniques for:

choices.text: Securing communication in the presence of adversaries.

questions.text: A 'derivation tree' (or parse tree) in the context of formal grammars shows:

choices.text: How a string can be generated by the grammar.
The states of a finite automaton.
The execution flow of a program.

questions.text: A 'decidable' problem is one for which there exists a Turing machine that will:

choices.text: Halt for all inputs and either accept or reject the string.
Halt only for strings that are in the language.
Use a finite amount of memory.

questions.text: 'Texture mapping' in computer graphics is a method for:

choices.text: Adding detail, surface texture, or color to a 3D model.
Calculating the lighting in a scene.

questions.text: A 'viewport' in computer graphics is a:

choices.text: 3D volume that defines what is visible in a scene.
A 2D rectangular area on the display device to which the window is mapped.
A coordinate system for defining objects.

questions.text: What is the main disadvantage of an array-based implementation of a list?

choices.text: Accessing an element by its index is slow.
The size of the array is fixed and cannot be easily changed.
It requires more memory than a linked list.
The elements are not stored in contiguous memory.

questions.text: What is the worst-case time complexity of the Quick Sort algorithm?
A 'log-based recovery' mechanism in a database system is used to:

choices.text: Ensure atomicity and durability by recording all modifications to the database.

questions.text: 'Demand paging' is a technique in virtual memory systems where a page is loaded into main memory:
'Usability testing' is a technique for evaluating a product by testing it with:
A 'class diagram' in UML is a type of:
The 'Observer' design pattern is a behavioral pattern used to:

choices.text: Ensure a class has only one instance.
Define a one-to-many dependency between objects so that when one object changes state, its dependents are notified.
Create objects without specifying their concrete classes.
Adapt the interface of one class to another.

questions.text: A 'monolithic architecture' is a traditional software design model where the application is built as:

choices.text: A collection of loosely coupled services.

questions.text: A 'genetic algorithm' is a search heuristic inspired by the process of:

choices.text: The functioning of the human brain

questions.text: In machine learning, the 'K-Nearest Neighbors' (KNN) algorithm is a type of:
The 'sigmoid' function is often used as an activation function in neural networks because it:

choices.text: Maps any real value into a range between 0 and 1.

questions.text: An 'isometric view' is a type of 3D representation where:

choices.text: The angles between the projection of the x, y, and z axes are all 120 degrees.
Only one side of the object is visible.

questions.text: The 'Net Present Value' (NPV) of an investment is the difference between:

choices.text: The total cash inflows and total cash outflows.
The present value of cash inflows and the present value of cash outflows.
The initial investment and the final salvage value.
The project's revenue and its cost.

questions.text: A 'Work Breakdown Structure' (WBS) is a deliverable-oriented hierarchical decomposition of the work to be executed by the project team. Its lowest level items are called:
The ethical principle of 'public interest' for an engineer means:

choices.text: Their primary obligation is to the safety, health, and welfare of the public.
They should only work on public projects.
They should make all their work public.
They should be interested in public opinion.

questions.text: To legally practice engineering in Nepal, an individual must be:

choices.text: A member of the Nepal Engineers' Association.
Registered with the Nepal Engineering Council.
A graduate of a Nepalese university.

questions.text: In a purely capacitive AC circuit, the power factor is:
The 'slew rate' of an op-amp limits its ability to amplify:

choices.text: Signals with a high common-mode voltage.

questions.text: A 'barrel shifter' is a digital circuit that can:

choices.text: Shift a data word by a specified number of bits in one clock cycle.
Count the number of set bits.

questions.text: A 'race condition' in concurrent programming occurs when:

choices.text: The behavior of a system depends on the non-deterministic timing of uncontrollable events.
A process is starved for resources.
The system is running too fast.

questions.text: The 'MAC address' is a unique identifier assigned to a network interface controller (NIC) and is used at which layer of the OSI model?
What is 'syntax analysis' or 'parsing'?

choices.text: The process of breaking the input string into tokens.
The process of checking if the sequence of tokens forms a valid sentence according to a grammar.
The process of generating machine code.
The process of checking the meaning of the program.

questions.text: A 'graph' is a non-linear data structure consisting of:

choices.text: A collection of nodes or vertices and edges that connect pairs of nodes.

questions.text: In C++, polymorphism allows:

choices.text: A single interface to represent different underlying forms (data types).
Creating new classes from existing ones.
Sharing a single variable among all objects of a class.

questions.text: 'Reinforcement Learning' is a type of machine learning where an agent learns:

choices.text: By finding patterns in unlabeled data.
By interacting with an environment and receiving rewards or penalties for its actions.
By following a predefined set of rules.

questions.text: A 'project manager' is responsible for:

choices.text: Providing the funding for the project.
Planning, executing, and closing the project to meet its objectives.
The long-term maintenance of the project's deliverable.

questions.text: A 'semiconductor' is a material whose conductivity is:

choices.text: Between that of a conductor and an insulator.

questions.text: What is a 'hazard' in a digital logic circuit?
The static keyword in C, when applied to a global variable, restricts its visibility to:

choices.text: The block in which it is defined.
The file in which it is defined.
The function in which it is defined.

questions.text: What is 'internal fragmentation' in memory management?

choices.text: Unused memory within a allocated block.
The total amount of unused memory.
A loss of memory due to swapping.

questions.text: The 'three-way handshake' in TCP is used to:
A problem is in the complexity class 'NP' (Non-deterministic Polynomial time) if:

choices.text: It can be solved in polynomial time.
A given solution can be verified in polynomial time.

questions.text: 'Refactoring' is the process of:

choices.text: Adding new features to the software.
Restructuring existing computer code without changing its external behavior.

questions.text: The 'A*' search algorithm uses the function $f(n) = g(n) + h(n)$, where $g(n)$ is the:

choices.text: Estimated cost from node $n$ to the goal.
Actual cost from the start node to node $n$.
Number of nodes expanded so far.

questions.text: A 'Gantt chart' is a bar chart that illustrates:
The 'cutoff region' of a BJT is when:

choices.text: It acts like a closed switch.
It acts like an open switch.

questions.text: A 100W light bulb is connected to a 200V supply. What is the resistance of the bulb? ($P = \frac{V^2}{R}$)
Design a combinational circuit that takes a 3-bit binary number as input and outputs a '1' if the number of 1s in the input is odd. This describes a(n):
A system uses 32-bit memory addresses and has a 256 KB cache. If the cache is direct-mapped and the block size is 16 bytes, how many bits of the address are used for the tag?

A router has learned two paths to the same destination network: Path 1 has a hop count of 5, and Path 2 has a hop count of 3. If the routing protocol is RIP (Routing Information Protocol), which path will be placed in the routing table?

choices.text: Path 1, because it was learned first.
Path 2, because it has a lower metric (hop count).
Both paths will be used for load balancing.
Neither path, as there is a conflict.

questions.text: A line is defined by the equation $y = 2x + 1$. What is the slope of a line that is perpendicular to this line?
What is the maximum number of nodes in a binary tree of height $h$? (Assuming the height of a tree with one node is 0)

A system has a total of 10 instances of a resource. Three processes P1, P2, and P3 have maximum needs of 5, 4, and 3 instances respectively. Currently, they hold 2, 2, and 1 instances. Is the current state safe according to the Banker's algorithm?

A project's critical path has an expected duration of 40 days and a variance of 9 days$^2$. What is the probability that the project will be completed in 46 days or less? (Assume a normal distribution. Z-value for 2.0 is approx 0.977)

What is the result of the following SQL query?
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE Salary BETWEEN 20000 AND 40000;

choices.text: Employees with a salary of exactly 20000 or 40000.
Employees with a salary greater than 20000 and less than 40000.
Employees with a salary greater than or equal to 20000 and less than or equal to 40000.

questions.text: What is the primary difference between 'black-box' and 'white-box' testing?

choices.text: Black-box testing is automated; white-box is manual.
White-box testing is done by the user; black-box is by the developer.
Black-box testing focuses on functionality without knowledge of internal code; white-box testing uses knowledge of the internal code structure.
Black-box is for performance; white-box is for security.

questions.text: What is the minimum bandwidth required to transmit a signal with 8 discrete levels at a rate of 1200 symbols per second, according to the Nyquist theorem?
In TCP, what is the purpose of the 'acknowledgment number'?

choices.text: To indicate the sequence number of the current packet.
To indicate the sequence number of the next byte the receiver expects to receive.
To specify the size of the receiver's buffer.
To signal the termination of a connection.

questions.text: Which of the following strings can be generated by the grammar: $S \rightarrow (S) \mid SS \mid \varepsilon$?

A confusion matrix for a binary classifier is given below. What is the accuracy of the model?
\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|}
\hline
True Positive (TP) & 80 \\
\hline
True Negative (TN) & 100 \\
\hline
False Positive (FP) & 10 \\
\hline
False Negative (FN) & 10 \\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\end{center}
In a file system that uses inodes, where are the pointers to the actual data blocks of a file stored?
Which design pattern would be suitable for adding new functionalities (like scrolling or borders) to a UI window object at runtime?
A 16-to-1 multiplexer requires how many selection lines?
If a project has an NPV of zero, what is the relationship between its IRR and the discount rate used?

choices.text: The IRR is equal to the discount rate.
The IRR is greater than the discount rate.
The IRR is less than the discount rate.
